ABNORMAL.Defintion: different from what is usual or average, especially in a way that is bad

ANALOGY.Defintion: a comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help explain a principle or idea

ARCHAIC.Defintion: of or belonging to an ancient period in history, very old

ARSENAL.Defintion: a building where weapons and military equipment are stored

CHORE.Defintion: a job or piece of work that is often boring or unpleasant but needs to be done regularly

CLARIFY.Defintion: to make something clear or easier to understand by giving more details or a simpler explanation

COMPOUNDS.Defintion: if something compounds, the benefits increase over time

CONJUGATIONS.Defintion: a group of verbs that conjugate in the same way

CORRELATION.Defintion: a connection or relationship between two or more facts, numbers, etc.

DEMOTIVATING.Defintion: making someone less enthusiastic about a job or task

DISRUPTIVE.Defintion: causing trouble and therefore stopping something from continuing as usual

DRIFT OVER.Defintion: to pass over without being properly absorbed or processed

EXPOSURE.Defintion: the fact of experiencing something or being affected by it because of being in a particular situation or place

EXTENSION.Defintion: the act of adding to something in order to make it bigger or longer

FAR REACHING.Defintion: something far-reaching has a great influence on many people or things

FOR STARTERS.Defintion: used to say that something is the first in a list of things

FOUNDATIONS.Defintion: the structures below the surface of the ground that support a building

FROM SCRATCH.Defintion: from the beginning, without using anything that already exists

HACKS.Defintion: a shortcut, a good solution or piece of advice

MEMORISING.Defintion: to learn something so that you will remember it exactly

MYRIAD.Defintion: a very large number of something

MYTH.Defintion: a commonly believed but false idea

MYTHS.Defintion: a commonly believed but false idea

NEUROSURGEON.Defintion: a doctor who performs operations involving the brain or nerves

ONGOING.Defintion: continuing to exist or develop, or happening at the present moment

OPTIMISTIC.Defintion: the quality of being full of hope and emphasizing the good parts of a situation, or a belief that something good will happen

PANDEMIC.Defintion: (of a disease) existing in almost all of an area or in almost all of a group of people, animals, or plants

PANORAMA.Defintion: a view of a wide area

PEDDLING.Defintion: to sell things, especially by taking them to different places

PERSPECTIVE.Defintion: a particular way of considering something

PILE.Defintion: objects positioned one on top of another

POINTLESS.Defintion: something that is pointless has no purpose, and it is a waste of time doing it

PREFACE.Defintion: if you preface your words or actions with something else, you say or do this other thing first

PREFIXES.Defintion: a letter or group of letters added to the beginning of a word to make a new word

RATIO.Defintion: the relationship between two groups or amounts that expresses how much bigger one is than the other

REJOICE.Defintion: to feel or show great happiness about something

RIDICULOUSLY.Defintion: in a way that is stupid or unreasonable and deserves to be laughed at

SCRABBLE.Defintion: a brand name for a game played on a board covered in squares in which players win points by creating words from letters with different values and connecting these words with ones already on the board

SEESAW.Defintion: a long board that children play on. The board is balanced on a central point so that when a child sits on each end they can make the board go up and down by pushing off the ground with their feet .

SOLIDIFY.Defintion: to become or make something become certain

SUFFIXES.Defintion: a letter or group of letters added at the end of a word to make a new word

SWING.Defintion: a seat joined by two ropes or chains to a metal bar or a tree, on which you can sit and move backwards and forwards

TEND TO.Defintion: to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic

TRICKY.Defintion: if a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill

VARY.Defintion: if things of the same type vary, they are different from each other, and if you vary them, you cause them to be different from each other
